Situation1: A heated dispute has escalated to the point where they are questioning staying together.
Expectation2: Provide clients with clear and accurate legal advice
Situation2: The client’s case grows more complex and requires detailed guidance
Story: I sat on the edge of my bed, phone pressed to my ear, my boyfriend’s voice sharp and wounded on the other end. Our argument had spiraled, and now he was questioning if we should even be together. He wanted me to talk, to fight for us, to resolve this before it broke us apart. My heart ached, but my mind was already racing ahead—my client’s file lay open on my laptop, emails piling up. The case had taken a complicated turn, and she was waiting for my call, expecting clarity and guidance only I could provide. I could hear the urgency in both voices—one pleading for reassurance, the other for expertise. I felt split in two, the weight of their needs pressing down on me. My boyfriend’s silence on the line was heavy, but so was the responsibility to my client. I stared at the clock, torn, knowing that whatever I chose, someone would be left waiting, and I couldn’t shake the fear that I might lose something important either way.
